title: Forms used to access Public Information under FOIA

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Please be so kind to provide blank versions of any forms, paper or electronic, the City of Stamford  Police Department has employed from January 1, 2019 to July 15, 2023, which have been designed for and provided any citizens who make Freedom of Information requests from that agency.  One iteration of each version, if multiple versions exist,  of the request form(s) is sufficient to satisfy this request.  

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 4 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robert Meehan

title: Vehicular Pursuit Policies (El Paso Police Department)

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Vehicular Pursuit Policies (El Paso Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All current policies maintained by the department regarding vehicle pursuits (also known as: car chase, vehicular response policy, vehicular pursuit procedure).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sydnee Coggins-Prioleau

communications.subject: Open Records Request :: W134921-071623
communications.communication:
In September 2021, the City of El Paso will transition to a hybrid work schedule. The City will continue to comply with the requirements of the TPIA. However, for more information on calculation of business days in light of COVID-19, please see HERE. 
Dear Sydnee Coggins-Prioleau: 
 
 
Thank you for your interest in public records of the City of El Paso. Your request has been received and is being processed in accordance with Chapter 552 of Texas Government Code, the Public Information Act. Your request was given the reference number W134921-071623 for tracking purposes. 
Records Requested: To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All current policies maintained by the department regarding vehicle pursuits (also known as: car chase, vehicular response policy, vehicular pursuit procedure).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sydnee Coggins-Prioleau

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fel-paso-police-department-673%252Fvehicular-pursuit-policies-el-paso-police-department-149200%252F%253Femail%253Dpdpios%252540elpasotexas.gov&url_auth_token=AAAdlGz2GYoq6bHmQag_-YGYfeA%3A1qLE70%3AQXyGhLXoXG_s1VMG9VRBe2PHKMKRr7C-qXXiHz6hnYI 
 
Your request will be forwarded to the relevant City department(s) to locate the information you seek and to determine the volume and any costs associated with satisfying your request. You will be contacted about the availability and/or provided with copies of the records in question. PLEASE NOTE: The Texas Public Information Act does not require a governmental body to create new information, to do legal research, or to answer questions. 
You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you'll receive an email when your request has been completed. Again, thank you for using the Public Information Center. 
City of El Paso

communications.subject: Open Records Request :: W134921-071623
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 

07/17/2023 
VIA ELECTRONIC MAIL (149200-33189737@requests.muckrock.com)Sydnee Coggins-Prioleau 

MuckRock News, DEPT MR149200 
263 Huntington Ave 
Boston MA 02115 

Re:  Open Record Request # W134921-071623 

Dear Sydnee Coggins-Prioleau: 

Your request, received 07/17/2023, has been forwarded to me and is being treated as a request for records under the Texas Public Information Act (Tex. Gov't Code Ann. §552.001 et seq.).  You requested the following information: 

 "...To Whom It May Concern:Please click on the link below to view the City's response to your information request.  The documents are available in an electronic format; therefore, there will be no charge for this response and your request is now considered closed. 

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records: 

All current policies maintained by the department regarding vehicle pursuits (also known as: car chase, vehicular response policy, vehicular pursuit procedure). 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Sydnee Coggins-Prioleau 

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fel-paso-police-department-673%252Fvehicular-pursuit-policies-el-paso-police-department-149200%252F%253Femail%253Dpdpios%252540elpasotexas.gov&url_auth_token=AAAdlGz2GYoq6bHmQag_-YGYfeA%3A1qLE70%3AQXyGhLXoXG_s1VMG9VRBe2PHKMKRr7C-qXXiHz6hnYI". 

You can use the link below to find Police Policies and Procedures of EPPD. 
https://elpaso.municipalcodeonline.com/book?type=publicpolice#name=EL_PASO_POLICE_DEPARTMENT_PROCEDURES_MANUAL The City of El Paso Public Information Center 

Sincerely, 

Erica Gandara/C1928 
Police Record Specialist/Open Records 
El Paso Police Department

communications.subject: [Records Center] Welcome to the Records Center!
communications.communication:
Dear Sydnee Coggins-Prioleau, 
 
Thank you for registering with Oxnard CA Public Records Center. 
 
Your Login ID is:  149201-13764608@requests.muckrock.com 
 
If you did not submit your request through the public portal but are receiving this e-mail, an account has been created for you where you can track and monitor the status of your request, and receive any documents in response to your request. 
 
 
If you have never used this system or cannot remember your password you may request a temporary password here: Request Temporary Password (https://u8387778.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=6HtRfOYLt5fXvpttM-2FU1HY0DTWkKuIj-2BHi8wCt7a1DDaqndKxKCNzICgX9Dg25kz61SDCPzQjp1ZxSAHt-2F3INFx9Q2WL-2BJmIyCU4R1N7tO8-3DyGE1_9MsTbFgXExQ9lfeeKUdHoGDjdlR-2BpYOiTpW2n-2FKiY-2Bkwmivtt-2BfzIDS-2Blu95aoW-2Bbxi8Fnuff74vNBfFNswwVmk-2BeaqiYoELsU3z2qYWUvRzeaRXQibaVTVW44RyY1TS2Y1PMxle8-2B5TsSiHLFGBmzdPlBb-2BAJTxzE-2FaLGuL4aroA5zQO2euse4FbYkBf4Bwo-2FMrYlQbij6sd5rVWaqAj-2BNXw-2F9UcOFasqkXBnECK4Q-3D) 
 
Please login to "My Request Center" to update your account information, track the status of your request and receive requested records when they become available. This is an auto-generated email and has originated from an unmonitored email account. Please DO NOT REPLY.

communications.subject: [Records Center] POLICE RECORDS REQUEST :: P000119-071623
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 

Good morning, 
All Oxnard Police Department policies are located online via our website under Transparency. Here is the link for easier access: https://sites.google.com/oxnardpd.org/department-policy-manual/department-policy-manual 
You can easily search for specific words to find everything we have related to vehicle pursuits. 
This was provided to you in my capacity as the Custodian of Records for the Oxnard Police Department and closes this request for information. 
Thank you, 
Beth Ward
